articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of China Evergrande (3333.HK) jumped as much as 42% in volatile trade on Tuesday, days after the embattled developer said its billionaire founder was being investigated over unspecified crimes.
articles.title: Evergrande shares volatile as trade resumes amid chairman probe

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Japanese authorities are facing renewed pressure to combat a sustained depreciation in the yen, as investors eye prospects of higher-for-longer U.S. interest rates while the Bank of Japan remains wedded to its super low interest rate policy.
articles.title: Explainer: What would Japanese intervention to boost the weak yen look like?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's central bank held interest rates steady on Tuesday for a fourth month, but again warned that further tightening might be needed to bring inflation to heel in a reasonable timeframe.
articles.title: Australia central bank holds rates at 4.1% for fourth month

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: X Corp, formerly known as Twitter, was sued in federal court in Florida on Monday by a legal-marketing company that claims the social media giant's new name infringes its trademark incorporating the letter "X."
articles.title: Elon Musk's X hit with trademark lawsuit from marketing agency

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: In a victory for Tesla (TSLA.O), a judge has ruled that a group of vehicle owners must pursue claims that the company misled about its Autopilot features in individual arbitration rather than court.
articles.title: Tesla scores Autopilot victory as judge rules owners must use arbitration

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) said Monday it was indefinitely laying off about 160 workers at plants in Indiana and Ohio because of the impact of the United Auto Workers strike on some facilities.
articles.title: GM furloughs another 160 workers due to UAW strike

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Blue Origin, the aerospace company founded by billionaire Jeff Bezos, expects to break up a corporate partnership formed years ago to build a commercial space station, reassigning staff and changing leadership as it adapts to more urgent priorities, according to several people familiar with the changes.
articles.title: Exclusive: Bezos' Blue Origin expects split on space station partnership -sources

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump and his family business are set to stand trial in New York on Monday in a civil fraud case that could deal a major blow to the former U.S. president’s real estate empire.
articles.title: Donald Trump's business empire in peril as civil fraud trial opens in New York

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: EU foreign ministers held their first ever meeting outside the bloc in Ukraine on Monday, a show of support for the country after a pro-Russian candidate won an election in Slovakia and the U.S. Congress omitted funding for Kyiv from a spending bill.
articles.title: EU ministers convene in Ukraine to show support after US, Slovakia wobbles

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: Nothing illustrates the crisis at the World Trade Organization more than the piling up of unresolved disputes and the growing list of what it terms the "trade concerns" of its members.
articles.title: At WTO, growing disregard for trade rules shows world is fragmenting
